climbs.name: Tasgrainian Devil
climbs.fa: Todd Swain and Gary Garrett, Nov. 1988

content.description: A nice finger crack and lieback.
content.protection: Standard rack, but mainly smaller pieces
content.location: This route is on the southwest face of the rock, and can be difficult to locate.  If you go to Live From Tasmania and look about 100 feet to the left, you can see a finger crack leading to an obvious lieback.

climbs.name: Seismo
climbs.fa: Bill Cramer, Michelle Cramer, Mike Shacklett, Mitch Shacklett, 5/1992.

content.description: Up the face right of Lurleen Never Tried It, passing a rusty fixed pin.
content.location: Same descent as for the Lurleen routes.

content.description: Right leaning crack, quite short, but worth doing if in the area.
content.protection: Standard rack, keep BD#2-4 for the anchor.
content.location: Located at south-west side of Jimmy Cliff. Scramble down from the top.

content.description: Vertical direct start to Lurleen Quits, to join about halfway and finish the same.
content.protection: Pro to 1", gear anchor using 2-4" cams with extra long extension.
content.location: Descend by scrambling off backside and connecting boulder tops to circle around to skier's right to come down the shallow gully located to the right of the climb.

content.description: Interesting moves for the grade and some questionable bolts add to the spice.  Better than it looks and right there while doing Grain of Truth.  Waltz up some easy low angle face to clip the first bolt and then you are on your way.
content.protection: 3 bolts and a medium wired protect the moves.  Belay at the top is some cams from 1" to 3".
content.location: This route takes the  featured face on a small formation just right of Grain of Truth.  I descended by walking back up (south) along the shoulder of the crag until you can drop into a very deep chimney system that will lead you back to the base.  Kinda sporty, but not too bad.

content.description: A high quality clean, steep, short hand crack.
content.location: On the southwest face of the rock, just left of Lurleen Quits.

content.description:
Begin either by scrambling up to the base of the crack or start directly up from the desert floor on somewhat crumbly rock.

Begin off a small pillar at the base of the crack.  The crux is early, negotiating the off balance moves getting to good finger locks.  The upper section is wide, but with plenty of options to stem and intermittent big holds.
content.protection: Normal rack of singles, a #4 Camalot or similar for the upper section.  To descend, you can either head all the way to the top, then negotiate the gully to the right back to the base.  Another option is to head up about 150' then head left up and over to the anchors on the top of Friendly Hands ( closer than you might think ).
content.location: Grain of Truth is located on the West Face of Jimmy Cliffs, just around and right of Friendly Hands etc. This alcove gets sun most of the day, and can be quite warm.  It ascends the right of two twin cracks in dark rock.

content.description: Walk to the southwest end of the Jimmy Cliff crag and boulder up to the base of the detached column. The route begins opposite Lurleen Quits on the northwest face ("Peanut Gallery" is on the east face of the column). Ascend the well-protected face on quality granite. Initially the climbing is moderate but becomes discernably more challenging near the top. Three out of five stars.
content.protection: This fine sport route ascends the northwest face of the detached block on the southernmost end of the Jimmy Cliff formation. Six bolts lead to sport anchors.

climbs.name: Bad Czech Girl
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon and Radim Bedin, April 1991

content.description: Slab face climb, crux is after 2nd bolt.
content.protection: There are 3 bolts for leading, gear anchor at the top, BD#2,3,4 will work, also have to extend the anchor.
content.location: Route is on the left side of "Lurleen Quits", scramble down from the top.
